data.name: Sum of all products
data.description:
We are given a (big big) array `a` of `n` numbers (`n>0` assumed). Taking any subset `I` of the range `0 .. (n-1)`, we obtain a *subarray* of `a`:
`[a[i] for i in sorted(I)]`. Your task is to calculate the sum of products of all nonempty subarrays of `a`. **Note.** You have to find an algorithm efficient enough so that the submit testcases would not timeout.

Examples

sum_of_products([12,13]) = 12 + 13 + 12*13 = 181 sum_of_products([2,3,7]) = 2 + 3 + 7 + 2*3 + 2*7 + 3*7 + 2*3*7 = 95 -------------- For your convenience, a `prod` function is predefined which inputs a nonempty array of numbers and returns their product. *If done, move onto the next Kata: http://www.codewars.com/kata/sum-of-certain-products*
